title: Disney's American Legends
content:
Any idea what the two fonts used in the words "American Legends" of Disney's video of the same name? Found below or at: [http://disneyvideos.disney.go.com/moviefinder/products/2423903.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141254/http:/disneyvideos.disney.go.com/moviefinder/products/2423903.html)   
   
 ![Disney's American Legengs](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141254im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20408.jpg)
author: holyhabanero

comments.content: The word "American" is too small to identify in your sample, except that it is some kind of roman face that's been stretched horizontally. I'm guessing Times. The word "Legends" is definitely hand-lettered.

For something with a similar feel to the _Legends_ text (albeit without as much flourish), you might try [Ovidius](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141254/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/ovidius/) from FontHaus.
